errors.error_description: The command for installing with conda is incorrect. It incorrectly uses `conda-forge` as the command instead of specifying it as the channel for the `conda install` command.
correction_candidates: Change the command to "$ conda install plotnine --from conda-forge".
Change the command to "$ conda install -c conda-forge plotnine".
Change the command to "$ pip install plotnine -f https://conda.anaconda.org/conda-forge/".
Change the command to "$ conda install anaconda/plotnine".
errors.golden_answer: Change the command to "$ conda install -c conda-forge plotnine".

errors.error_description: The instruction for ensuring consistent test images is incorrect. It suggests installing `freetype-py`, which is the wrong package and procedure. The correct procedure is to build `matplotlib` from source to link against the system's FreeType library correctly.
correction_candidates: Replace the command with "$ pip install matplotlib --no-binary matplotlib" and update the explanatory text to mention installing matplotlib from source.
Change the command to "$ brew install freetype" for macOS users.
Change the command to "$ pip install --upgrade --force-reinstall matplotlib".
Add a note that this step is only required for Windows.
errors.golden_answer: Replace the command with "$ pip install matplotlib --no-binary matplotlib" and update the explanatory text to mention installing matplotlib from source.
